result.execSummary:
The defendant Stacy Lynn Mikyska was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of extended supervision are the same as the conditions of probation.

miscConds.notes: lf extended supervision is revoked and the defendant will have a mandatory release from prison, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol.

Defendant shall not possess/consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent, and shall complete any recommended treatment.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice. 

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall comply with, and successfully complete, the Washington County Drug Treatment Court Program.

timeConds.notes:
NO HUBER.

STAYED - to be used by Drug Treatment Court Judge, if necessary.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stacy Lynn Mikyska

records.addlTxt: disposition form

Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Stacy Lynn Mikyska in court, in custody.  Attorney Andrew D Leech in court for Stacy Lynn Mikyska. CASES CALLED:  22CF175, 21CF422, 20CF108. Counsel makes record of request to resolve all 3 cases today in Br 4.  Court agrees to preside based on request of parties.  Def waives preliminary hearing.  Court questions def, accepts waiver and binds def over; State to file Info w/in 48 hrs.  Agreement reached.  State moves to dismiss and read-in Ct 2, Ct 3, Ct 4, Ct 5; Court so orders.  Def enters guilty plea to Ct 1.  Court finds def guilty on Ct 1.  Statements from State and counsel. Court proceeds to sentencing.

Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Stacy Lynn Mikyska in court, in custody.  Attorney Beltran for Atty Timothy Drewa in court for Stacy Lynn Mikyska. Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Hearing on June 7, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Not possess/use any controlled substance without valid prescription. No contact with M.T. except 3rd party to retrieve vehicle. Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. (Defendant refused to sign)

Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Stacy Lynn Mikyska appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Wilfred P. de Junco in court for Stacy Lynn Mikyska. Def consents to appearing by video.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Atty Drewa to be appointed as he represents in other matters.  Counsel reserved argument on bail for future, if needed. Court sets $2500 cash bond.  Def waives time limits on preliminary hearing; Court accepts.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Hearing on May 9, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
